laboratory_examinations.findings: Very low LH levels (<0.15 IU/liter), indicating hypogonadotropic state. Normal range in adults: LH, 2.8–7.1 IU/liter.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Initially very low LH levels were observed. After pulsatile GnRH administration (100 ng/kg every 60 min), LH pulses were detected on day 18.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Normal or nearly normal FSH levels were observed despite low LH levels. Normal range in adults: FSH, 2.4–7.0 IU/liter.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: FSH levels responded excessively to the GnRH challenge test, distinguishing it from the LH response.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Very low plasma testosterone levels (0.15 ng/ml; normal range: 2.8–9.0 ng/ml).
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Testosterone levels increased after pulsatile GnRH administration.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Very low estradiol levels (in cases of normal karyotype; specific values not provided).
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Estradiol levels increased after pulsatile GnRH administration.
